Utilities¶

Plotting¶

There exists several built in plotting tools to help visualize a StarCluster.

Functions¶

nscatter(x, y[, z, xlabel, ylabel, legend, …])

NAME:

nplot(x, y[, ptype, xlabel, ylabel, legend, …])

NAME:

nlplot(x, y[, ltype, xlabel, ylabel, …])

NAME:

nhist(x[, nbin, xlabel, legend, title, …])

NAME:

nhist2d(x, y[, nbin, xlabel, ylabel, title, …])

NAME:

ndens(x, y[, z, normed, xstep, ystep, sigx, …])

NAME:

starplot(cluster[, coords, xlim, ylim, …])

NAME:

skyplot(cluster[, coords, xlim, ylim, …])

NAME:

Output¶

There exists several built in tools for creating standardized output files.

Functions¶

extrct_out(cluster, fileout[, projected])

NAME:

snapout(cluster, filename[, energies, …])

NAME:

fortout(cluster[, filename, …])

NAME:

gyrout(cluster[, filename])

NAME:

Coordinates¶

While coordinate transformations to a StarCluster are handled via Operations, users may find the below functions helpful if trying to manually do some coordinate transformations. Note that several of these functions are wrappers around galpy coordinate transformations.

Functions¶

sphere_coords(cluster)

NAME:

cart_to_sphere(x, y, z, vx, vy, vz)

NAME:

cyl_coords(cluster)

NAME:

cart_to_cyl(x, y, z, vx, vy, vz)

NAME:

sky_coords(cluster)

NAME:

Recipes¶

Finally, several functions that are used throughout StarCluster that users may find helpful are listed below.

Constants¶

For convenience purposes, a few constants are saved to be used globally throughout clustertools. A function that prints the conversion table between kw and stellar evolution type, as discussed in Cluster is also included here.

Functions¶

kwtypes()

NAME:
